title: Lead Front End Software Engineer
content:
At GFiber, we believe in the power of great internet that lets people do more, helps communities get stronger and makes amazing things possible. We’re not just growing to build better internet experiences, we’re also building a welcoming place where people who want to make a difference can grow their careers.
GFiber is an Alphabet company that brings Google Fiber and Google Fiber Webpass internet services to homes and businesses across the United States. Our growing, inclusive team is expanding as we connect more cities and people. About the Job




 

Dynamic Environment: The whole team is passionate about building a beautiful and sustainable consumer product. You will work in a small cross-functional team that owns an area (like revamping our UI to use a server-driven widget model, introducing a new live chat feature, etc.) while getting the benefits of working in a larger team (great code quality norms, wide view and impact on the larger product).
We are looking for people that are passionate about UI and web development engineering to help reimagine and enhance our GFiber web app to help make it easy to integrate new solutions.
GFiber as an opportunity provides scope to grow technically, as well as leadership-wise.
Be able to work at Alphabet while having the advantage of Google infrastructure and backing.
Our leadership cares about culture, listens to feedback, and is transparent about decisions.
GFiber encourages individuals of all backgrounds to apply.





 
In this role, you’ll:





Exercise strong technical leadership through modeling best practice coding in the web frontend, designing high performance, extensible and scalable software systems, and influencing stakeholders and cross functional teams towards a world class customer experience at GFiber
Develop and land great user experiences in a fun environment, with 50%+ hands-on coding
Design and develop compelling features by collaborating with product/business, UX, QA, backend, and other client engineers.





 
At a minimum we’d like you to have:





Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, similar technical field of study, or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of experience working with Web technologies (Javascript & Typescript, CSS, Angular, NextJS, React or similar).
5 years of backend development experience
Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English.





 
It’s preferred if you have:





Ability to debug and develop across a deep stack.
Cypress, Jest, Webdriver, Selenium, and Test Driven Development experience.
Micro frontends and server-driven UI experience.
Ability to work with UX, and Product owners.
Experience functioning as a Tech Lead on a software development team





 
 
The US base salary range for this full-time position is between $209k - $230k + bonus + equity + benefits. Your recruiter will share more about the specific salary range for your targeted location during the hiring process.GFiber is committed to equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or Veteran status. Disclosure is voluntary, and this information will be kept confidential in compliance with Google's Candidate Privacy Policy. For more information please refer to our Equal Employment Opportunity Policy and the EEOC's "Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal" (PDF). 
It's important to us to create an accessible, inclusive workplace for everyone. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our accommodations for applicants form. Our candidate accommodations team will then connect with you to confidentially discuss your options.

demographic_questions.description:
At GFiber, we value belonging and believe in fostering an environment where a diversity of perspectives can thrive. This core value is the North Star of our business and critical to our success. This voluntary self-identification form contains questions that help us comply with our legal obligations, where applicable, and assists us with our voluntary diversity efforts. Your responses will be kept for future applications and you can change them at any time. Please click here to learn more about our Equal Opportunities.

  • Voluntary Self ID for Disability
  • Pay Transparency Policy
  • Protected Veteran Qualification

1Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended. For more information about this form or the equal employment obligations of Federal contractors, visit the U.S. Department of Labor's Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs (OFCCP) website at www.dol.gov/ofccp.

PUBLIC BURDEN STATEMENT: According to the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995 no persons are required to respond to a collection of information unless such collection displays a valid OMB control number. This survey should take about 5 minutes to complete.
